properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 13 at 2:19PM EST until January 13 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
At 2:15 PM EST, Greenwood County Emergency Management indicates
numerous roads were flooded as a result of heavy rainfall early this
morning and several roads remain flooded, primarily across the
southern third of the county, generally south of SC 34 and Ninety-
Six.  Storm-total rainfall amounts of 2-4 inches occurred across
most of Greenwood County, with an area of 3-4.5 inches observed
generally along a line from Bradley to Ninety-Six.

Several roads remain closed, including:
Hunter Rd at County Line Rd;
Bethel Rd near Jordan Rd;
Dendy Bridge Rd near Indian Rd;
Warner Rd at Old Hastings Rd;
Tillman Territory Rd at Kinard Rd;
Paysinger Rd at Hwy 248;
McKenzie Rd; and
Tedards Store Rd;

Please obey all barricades, even where water isn't covering the
roadway.  Roads and bridges must be inspected by engineers following
flooding to ensure they were not compromised and barricades are in
place for your safety.

Only light showers are expected through this afternoon and early
evening; therefore, the Flood Warning will be allowed to expire on
time. However, since several roads will remain flooded for several
more hours, a Flood Advisory will replace the Flood Warning and
remain in effect through this evening.

Additional rounds of rainfall are expected tonight through early
tomorrow morning which may exacerbate residual flooding or cause new
flooding to develop. People in the Greenwood County area are advised
to stay weather aware.
properties.instruction:
Numerous roads, parking lots and bridges will be threatened by heavy
rain and rapidly rising streams and creeks. Please pay close
attention to road signs indicating a flood-prone area. Obey all
barricades, even if water is not currently over the road. Barricades
are in place for your protection and indicate areas where flooding
can occur rapidly and without warning.

NWSheadline: A FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM EST FOR GREENWOOD COUNTY
